div.p: Intraoral findings: On exam of the right lower quadrant, tooth #30 was sensitive to percussion (lingering for 45 seconds) and to cold (sharp, stops when cold removed). No sensitivity to palpation, Radiographic pain upon biting; with relief upon opening. No evidence of new caries on distal; missing #28, replaced with endo implant; #32 impacted with apparent full boney. One cm swelling present on buccal gingivae around #29 and #30 with sinus tract present #30B.
Paraoral findings: 2 small, mobile lymph nodes found in right submandibular area.

display.value: History of family member diseases Narrative

div.p: Patient A said the pain started 2 weeks ago and has progressively worsened.
He noticed sharp, stabbing pain provoked by drinking cold beverages in the past week and lingering pain with biting in the last 2 days.
He is able to eat regular food but only chews on the left side.
He takes 400 mg ibuprofen every 8 hours for pain.
His last doses was 2 hours prior to this visit.

display.value: Physical findings of General status Narrative

div.p: Good, except for reporting pain in lower RQ

tr.td: Finding of Functional Performance and Activity

Panoramic radiograph (D0330) exposed. Radiographic results showed #32 full bony impaction, #28 endosteal (root form) implant with full crown restoration, and tooth #30 with small PA lesion mesial root. Radiographic caries lesion #29 distal caries lesion (ADA Caries Classification System moderate caries lesion). Other WNL

div.p: Referral to endodontist for evaluation of #30 and endodontic therapy #30. Referral includes medications prescribed, diagnosis, prognosis, treatment notes, images, and follow up recommendations to be sent from Dentist to Endodontist
Suspect irreversible pulpitis with necrotic pulp and periapical pathosis. Tooth is restorable despite possible incomplete fracture DB cusp #30.

tr.td: 2 puffs every two to four hours as needed for wheezing
